alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:47PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fremont and north central Custer Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 146 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Florence, or 12 miles northwest of Junkins Burn Scar, moving northeast at 5 mph. Heavy rain may lead to enhanced streamflow along creeks and rivers. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Fremont and north central Custer Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
